pr_title: Makes ITHttpAsyncClient accept a normal type

timeline.message: Makes ITHttpAsyncClient accept a normal type

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change *

One of success or failure callbacks must be invoked even on unexpected scenarios. For *

Invoke the callback with one of success or failure even in unexpected scenarios. For
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,9 +37,11 @@ * *

One of success or failure callbacks must be invoked even on unexpected scenarios. For

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/instrumentation/http-tests/src/main/java/brave/test/http/ITHttpAsyncClient.java b/instrumentation/http-tests/src/main/java/brave/test/http/ITHttpAsyncClient.java index fb53e8b46..593885cc4 100644 --- a/instrumentation/http-tests/src/main/java/brave/test/http/ITHttpAsyncClient.java +++ b/instrumentation/http-tests/src/main/java/brave/test/http/ITHttpAsyncClient.java @@ -35,7 +35,7 @@ public abstract class ITHttpAsyncClient extends ITHttpClient { * implementation coerces a 500 code without an exception as an error, you should call the success * callback directly. * - *

One of success or failure callbacks must be invoked even on unexpected scenarios. For + *

Invoke the callback with one of success or failure even in unexpected scenarios. For * example, if there is a cancelation that didn't result in an error, invoke {@link * BiConsumer#accept(Object, Object)} with your own {@link CancellationException}. *
